item.title: Minecraft Fan Reveals Awesome Mob Concept Based on the Gameâ€™s Squids
item.description:
Highlights

  • A gigantic squid and other concepts are part of a fanfiction project called Minecraft: Titans from artist BBMRedditAcc, with the squid in particular being far more creepy and memorable than the official Minecraft design.
  • The story of the fan's project revolves around modern-day builders discovering ancient land with huge mobs and ancient builders.
  • Teasers for future mobs include an Enderman Titan and Redstone Titans, with many of the ideas in the project inspired by fan theories about Minecraft lore.

MInecraft is full of quirky mobs and terrifying creatures as it is, but one fan is taking things a step further and reimagining some of them as titanic beasts, starting with the squid, which they gave a colossal makeover with their artwork. The art of the Minecraft mob depicts a giant, blocky squid with long, protruding tentacles and an elaborate elongated head resembling that of an octopus.

The "Squid Titan" is part of a series of concepts the artist is working on for a story called Minecraft : Titans , which is a fanfiction work of their own creation that reimagines some of the established concepts from the game. The artist seems to have a full-fledged storyline in the works, with multiple characters and a continuous plot based on their own interpretation of Minecraft 's lore and history.

Related
Minecraft Player Finds Item That Shouldn't Exist

A Minecraft player finds a valuable item during their adventures, but they are surprised to realize that their find has a rather unusual detail.

Reddit user BBMRedditAcc, the original artist, shared an image to the r/Minecraft community that depicts the Squid Titan alongside several other concepts and in-game Minecraft assets used as inspiration for their work. The post is allegedly the first of many to come, as the creator of the series announced plans to continue the series with more concept art as they finish them, though currently it is unknown when that may occur.

Player-Made Art Makes Minecraft Squids Much Scarier

It was here that the artist also revealed their Minecraft: Titans fanfiction project as well and provided some detailed information about the story, characters, and lore. While the specific plot details are still vague as of now, the story will reportedly revolve around a group of modern-day Minecraft builders stumbling upon an ancient land once inhabited by massive titans and "Ancient Builders" who worked the land to ruins.

They also teased a series of concepts that they plan to reveal in the future, such as the Enderman Titan, Redstone Titans and various others based on some of Minecraft's mobs, blocks and items. According to the artist's comments on the original post, the story is inspired heavily by fan theories about Minecraft that have circulated online for years, which have attempted to explain its history and lore in various ways.

Some fans even suggested the idea be made into an official Minecraft mod, which could be feasible with the right developers, since story-based maps and Minecraft mods have existed for years. In any case, there is still seemingly much more to come from the Minecraft : Titans project, and though it remains to be seen just how far it may go, the concept alone is certainly an ambitious one.

item.title: Bungie Offers Destiny 2 Players Advice On How to Prepare for The Final Shape
item.description:
Highlights

  • Bungie teases Ritual Pathfinder mechanic details while offering a warning to Destiny 2 players prepping for The Final Shape expansion.
  • Players are advised to prioritize their time and not hold onto Vanguard, Crucible, and Gambit bounties, which will be abandoned on June 4.
  • However, players looking to bounty prep still have alternative ways to gain an XP head start including vendors in different locations.

Bungie reveals new details about the upcoming Ritual Pathfinder mechanic and how it will impact vendor bounties and Destiny 2 players attempting to optimize their XP gain prior to the expansion's launch. With the Destiny 2 community feeling revitalized following Into The Light, Bungie has managed to keep that momentum going forward by revealing a constant stream of new details and information regarding The Final Shape expansion . A recent developer update gave fans a massive look at a lot of the new content coming in the expansion, from the new Dread enemy faction, the Pale Heart destination, and the highly customizable Prismatic subclass.

As with many expansions, players attempt to get a jumpstart on the leveling process for the seasonal artifact by stacking completed bounties so that when the new content arrives, they get a massive boost in XP. With The Final Shape approaching, the preparations have begun for most Destiny 2 players, especially since Bungie recently confirmed the new Power band pinnacle cap being set at 2000 and that the entire system and UI has been overhauled into a new adjusted Fireteam Power mechanic. However, for those prepping, Bungie provided a handy tip and warning for players utilizing bounties from the classic Tower vendors.

Related
Destiny 2 Reveals Prismatic Exotic Class Item Perks

Bungie confirms the perk combinations available when equipping the new exotic class items with the Destiny 2 prismatic subclass.

The Destiny 2 Team account posted a warning for players planning to hold onto Vanguard, Crucible, and Gambit bounties, which are going to be outright replaced by the Ritual Pathfinder mechanic. While Destiny 2 's new Pathfinder System was revealed last year , Bungie has announced that it plans to dive into more details in the coming weeks. The previous sneak peek showcased a branching tree system where players could earn more rewards by reaching certain nodes, advancing to a waiting engram at the end of the path. Considering this early look was made all the way back in August 2023, it's highly likely that the then in-progress UI has changed, though fans won't have to wait too much longer to see for themselves.

What Happens to Vendor Bounties when Destiny 2: The Final Shape Launches?

Still, this isn't the complete death knell for bounty prepping, as Bungie specifically calls out Vanguard, Crucible, and Gambit bounties. While those bounties will be abandoned on June 4, even if completed ahead of time, players still have alternative ways to gain a head start on their XP, including specific vendors like Eris Morn on the Moon, the Dreaming City with Petra, Neomuna, Europa, and many other locations. For those attempting to prepare for the launch of Destiny 2 : The Final Shape , there are still options, even if a few common ones have been minimized.

In the meantime, players have had the opportunity to complete their collection of deepsight weapons as Bungie made craftable weapons from the past four seasons much easier to obtain. Each day, Destiny 2 players can play a seasonal activity to earn Deepsight weapons . Better yet, the limited time bonus takes into account which weapons have yet to be obtained, giving fans a much better chance to earn the weapon they need on a daily basis.

item.title: Overwatch 2 Players Point Out Massive Missed Opportunity For Doomfist Skins
item.description:
Highlights

  • Tank heroes like Doomfist are vital for gameplay in Overwatch 2, as they create space and protect teammates with high durability and damage-absorbing abilities.
  • Just like with other roles, Tank players like to see their favorite characters get cool skins, and Redditor WhoopsAhoy has pointed out a golden opportunit for Doomfist cosmetics.
  • Despite fan requests for skins honoring previous Doomfist gauntlet bearers, it remains to be seen if Blizzard will ever add outfits based on the Savior and the Scourge, which were featured on the map Numbani years ago.

An Overwatch 2 player highlights a significant oversight regarding potential skins for the tank hero Doomfist. Tank heroes play a crucial role in Overwatch 2 , serving as the frontline defenders and protectors of their team. With their high health pools and abilities to absorb damage, tank heroes create space for their teammates to operate, control objectives, and initiate team fights.

Speaking of tank heroes, Blizzard is gearing up to implement substantial buffs for tanks in the upcoming mid-Season 10 patch for Overwatch 2 , particularly targeting Wrecking Ball and Junker Queen. These adjustments, set to roll out on May 14, aim to enhance the durability of tanks and refine their abilities within the game's evolving meta. Tanks will now receive 25% less damage from headshots and their knockback resistance will be increased from 30% to 50%. This is certainly a good adjustment for characters like Doomfist, though fans of the Talon leader would also see Blizzard release a few skins based on the character's lore.

Related
NBA Star Luka Doncic Reveals Impressive Overwatch 2 Accomplishment

NBA superstar Luka Doncic from Dallas Mavericks achieves a major milestone in Overwatch 2, showing his gaming prowess alongside his basketball skills.

Overwatch 2 Fan Shares Concept for Doomfist Skin

Recently, a Reddit thread sparked conversation about the absence of Doomfist skins honoring the gauntlet's previous bearers. Some users pointed out parallels with other heroes who have received skins reflecting alternate or past versions of themselves, such as Reinhardt's Starcraft and Crusader skins. While some fans have found solace in skins like Mirrorwatch Doomfist, which bears resemblance to the original Savior Doomfist, many argue that it doesn't fully capture the essence of the previous gauntlet holder. Others suggest that thematic inconsistencies might be preventing the introduction of such skins, which were depicted on the Numbani map.

This is not the first fan-made concept for a Doomfist skin. Recently, another Overwatch 2 fan has captivated the community's imagination with a striking skin concept, transforming Doomfist into the iconic God of War character, Kratos . The fan-made skin, showcased on Reddit, redesigned Doomfist to embody Kratos' attire, facial features, and warpaint while retaining the original character's silhouette. This imaginative crossover got widespread admiration from the Overwatch 2 community, with many advocating for its inclusion as an event skin, despite potential hurdles due to ownership issues between Microsoft, which owns Overwatch , and Sony, which owns the God of War franchise.

While the midseason update will introduce a collaboration between the game and Porsche, featuring a sleek white Macan Turbo Electric skin for D.Va in Overwatch 2 , it remains to be seen when Doomfist will get another skin - and if he'll ever get designs based on the Savior and the Scourge.

item.title: Hilarious The Last of Us 2 Bug Shows Ellie Dying Mid-Cutscene
item.description:
Highlights

  • Bugs in The Last of Us 2 can cause untimely deaths, and that exact thing happened to an unlucky Permadeath player mid-cutscene.
  • In the clip shared by Reddit user OK_Meat_440, Ellie was shown falling through the ground to her demise during a conversation with Dina.
  • Thankfully, selection of "per chapter" saved the player from starting over completely, as they only had to return to the start of the chapter.

It's no secret that even the most high-profile video game releases can have their share of quirks and glitches, as one The Last of Us 2 player can attest after a bug led to their untimely death in the middle of a cutscene. The player was sitting back watching the scene play out as usual when it was rudely interrupted by the sudden death of The Last of Us 2 protagonist Ellie after she inexplicably fell through the floor and died.

To make matters worse, the player was allegedly in the midst of a permadeath run in The Last of Us 2 , meaning that the unfortunate bug could have cost them some precious progress. Luckily for them, they had selected the "per chapter" setting, meaning their progress will only reset to the beginning of that chapter, which in this case, is right before the scene in question.

Related
Disturbing The Last of Us 2 Bug Turns Dina Into a Human Backpack

A Last of Us 2 player online shares a disturbing glitch that they have discovered, which turns Ellie's companion Dina into a human backpack.

The player shared a clip of the whole fiasco on Reddit in the official community for The Last of Us, depicting the whole thing as Ellie speaks to Dina in an emotionally-charged conversation before suddenly falling out of bounds through the floor and dying. The clip ends with a brief menu confirming the player's permadeath status and that, fortunately, they only lost about five minutes of progress since the scene occurs at the beginning of the chapter.

This The Last of Us 2 Cutscene Bug Has Apparently Happened Before

Apparently, this is not the first time this has happened, either, as the original poster mentioned in a reply to someone's comment that it happened to them multiple times in the past, which is why they chose to play on the "per chapter" mode to prevent a significant loss of progress. Others chimed in as well, stating that they had experienced similar The Last of Us 2 glitches throughout their playthroughs, with some saying it's so frequent that it discourages them from doing a "whole game" permadeath run.

The Last of Us 2 received a permadeath mode after a free update alongside the ultra-difficult "Grounded" setting, with the update encouraging players to combine the two for a brutal survival experience. Carried over from the first game, "Grounded" mode removes players' HUDs and effectively makes The Last of Us 2 extremely realistic , as Ellie and Abby can die in a single hit from most of the game's enemies and have very little ammo and materials to work with.

It is unclear whether the user was playing the original release or the remastered version that came out on PS5 earlier this year. In any case, though, occasional glitches are nothing new for Naughty Dog, as they thankfully happen far less often in The Last of Us 2 than they did in the intense backlash for the notoriously buggy PC release of The Last of Us Part 1 .

item.title: EA Reveals How Much Revenue Apex Legends Has Generated
item.description:
Highlights

  • Apex Legends has earned EA $3.4 billion, solidifying its position as a major player in the free-to-play gaming space.
  • The game's success is attributed to its accessibility, fast-paced gameplay, tactical depth, and content updates.
  • Despite previous slowdowns, Apex Legends continues to thrive with over 300,000 daily players and ongoing investments from EA.

Electronic Arts (EA) recently revealed that its free-to-play battle royale title, Apex Legends , has earned the company $3.4 billion to date. This figure not only proves Apex Legends ' status as a major player in the free-to-play space, but also positions it among the most successful video games of all time.

Apex Legends first entered the live-service scene in 2019 from Titanfall developer Respawn Entertainment. Although it launched with minimal fanfare, the game quickly caught on thanks to its free-to-play accessibility, fast-paced gameplay, tactical depth, and a cast of memorable characters. Maintaining a live-service game via content updates is the other side of the success equation, and Respawn has mostly delivered there as well. Apex Legends is currently in Season 21 , and the studio has shown no signs of letting up thus far.

Related
Apex Legends Dev Discusses High-Level and Casual Meta Balancing

Game Rant sits down with Apex Legends' design director Evan Nikolich to talk about the meta, Alter, and designing around popular comps.

During EA's Q4 and 2024 fiscal year earnings call, it was disclosed that Apex Legends has amassed $3.4 billion in net bookings since its release in February 2019. This figure was discovered in the full document outlining the contents of the earnings call, with a quote from EA CEO Andrew Wilson stating, "Since its surprise, smash-hit release in 2019, the HD title of Apex Legends has surpassed $3.4 billion in lifetime net bookings." The CEO also made the controversial statement about EA potentially implementing in-game ads for AAA titles during this earnings call.

EA's CEO Confirms Continued Investment into Apex Legends

The usage of the "net bookings" metric is interesting, as it's different from outright revenue. Net bookings account for deductions and fees from the revenue, so it's likely that the latter is even higher than $3.4 billion. Considering the game only monetizes cosmetics, Apex Legends has accrued a staggering amount of money for EA, and Wilson remains committed to continue investing in "broadening the audience by building upon the epic characters of this world that go beyond the current Battle Royale." With Season 21 of Apex Legends bringing new cosmetics , artifacts, and more, the game's popularity is unlikely to wane.

Despite facing some slowdown earlier in the year, Apex Legends ' high-ranking position in the free-to-play space seems fairly solid. With over 300,000 concurrent players daily, it's undoubtedly one of EA's most important IPs. Respawn is also keen on incorporating player feedback, as the game's latest Upheaval season will feature the return of a Limited Time Mode for Apex Legends that was heavily requested by fans, as well as Solos, which will replace Duos until June 24. In the past year, Respawn has also made Apex Legends more palatable for newcomers with the Three Strikes and Straight Shot limited-time events.
